title: Stuck on a particular block while syncing: Internal error while importing block
body:
I'm trying a fresh sync on Medalla, but have become stuck on a particular block. The following message just repeats exactly (with the same block root mentioned) every few seconds and the sync is not making progress. Note that this block is from long before the current network chaos.

```
08:45:30.362 WARN  - Failed to import block from peer (err: INTERNAL_ERROR) SignedBeaconBlock{message=BeaconBlock{root=0x9054b9a5ee54075f3b1251f2892b4df7034612be384c0dfc245e6ac93c98b613, slot=39425, proposer_index=>
08:45:32.375 INFO  - Sync Event  *** Current slot: 77927, Head slot: 39423, Connected peers: 80
08:45:39.342 ERROR - Internal error while importing block: BeaconBlock{root=0x9054b9a5ee54075f3b1251f2892b4df7034612be384c0dfc245e6ac93c98b613, slot=39425, proposer_index=18074, parent_root=0xb351150d7786a65fe38c9c>
java.util.concurrent.CompletionException: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: State must belong to the given block
        at java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture.encodeThrowable(CompletableFuture.java:331) ~[?:?]
        at java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture.completeThrowable(CompletableFuture.java:346) ~[?:?]
        at java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture$UniAccept.tryFire(CompletableFuture.java:704) ~[?:?]
        at java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture.postComplete(CompletableFuture.java:506) ~[?:?]
        at java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture.completeExceptionally(CompletableFuture.java:2159) ~[?:?]
        at tech.pegasys.teku.infrastructure.async.SafeFuture.lambda$propagateResult$2(SafeFuture.java:129) ~[teku-infrastructure-async-0.12.4-SNAPSHOT.jar:0.12.4-dev-df300e3b]
        at java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture.uniWhenComplete(CompletableFuture.java:859) ~[?:?]
        at java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture$UniWhenComplete.tryFire(CompletableFuture.java:837) ~[?:?]
        at java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture.postComplete(CompletableFuture.java:506) ~[?:?]
        at java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture.completeExceptionally(CompletableFuture.java:2159) ~[?:?]
        at tech.pegasys.teku.infrastructure.async.SafeFuture.lambda$propagateToAsync$11(SafeFuture.java:222) ~[teku-infrastructure-async-0.12.4-SNAPSHOT.jar:0.12.4-dev-df300e3b]
        at tech.pegasys.teku.infrastructure.async.SafeFuture.fromRunnable(SafeFuture.java:138) ~[teku-infrastructure-async-0.12.4-SNAPSHOT.jar:0.12.4-dev-df300e3b]
        at tech.pegasys.teku.infrastructure.async.AsyncRunner.lambda$runAsync$0(AsyncRunner.java:24) ~[teku-infrastructure-async-0.12.4-SNAPSHOT.jar:0.12.4-dev-df300e3b]
        at tech.pegasys.teku.infrastructure.async.SafeFuture.ofComposed(SafeFuture.java:85) ~[teku-infrastructure-async-0.12.4-SNAPSHOT.jar:0.12.4-dev-df300e3b]
        at tech.pegasys.teku.infrastructure.async.ScheduledExecutorAsyncRunner.lambda$createRunnableForAction$1(ScheduledExecutorAsyncRunner.java:119) ~[teku-infrastructure-async-0.12.4-SNAPSHOT.jar:0.12.4-dev-df30>
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1128) [?:?]
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:628) [?:?]
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:830) [?:?]
Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: State must belong to the given block
        at com.google.common.base.Preconditions.checkArgument(Preconditions.java:142) ~[guava-29.0-jre.jar:?]
        at tech.pegasys.teku.datastructures.blocks.SignedBlockAndState.<init>(SignedBlockAndState.java:32) ~[teku-ethereum-datastructures-0.12.4-SNAPSHOT.jar:0.12.4-dev-df300e3b]
        at tech.pegasys.teku.storage.server.rocksdb.RocksDbDatabase.getFinalizedBlockAndState(RocksDbDatabase.java:446) ~[teku-storage-0.12.4-SNAPSHOT.jar:0.12.4-dev-df300e3b]
        at tech.pegasys.teku.storage.server.rocksdb.RocksDbDatabase.updateFinalizedData(RocksDbDatabase.java:402) ~[teku-storage-0.12.4-SNAPSHOT.jar:0.12.4-dev-df300e3b]
        at tech.pegasys.teku.storage.server.rocksdb.RocksDbDatabase.doUpdate(RocksDbDatabase.java:350) ~[teku-storage-0.12.4-SNAPSHOT.jar:0.12.4-dev-df300e3b]
        at tech.pegasys.teku.storage.server.rocksdb.RocksDbDatabase.update(RocksDbDatabase.java:173) ~[teku-storage-0.12.4-SNAPSHOT.jar:0.12.4-dev-df300e3b]
        at tech.pegasys.teku.storage.server.ChainStorage.lambda$onStorageUpdate$0(ChainStorage.java:92) ~[teku-storage-0.12.4-SNAPSHOT.jar:0.12.4-dev-df300e3b]
        at tech.pegasys.teku.infrastructure.async.SafeFuture.fromRunnable(SafeFuture.java:138) ~[teku-infrastructure-async-0.12.4-SNAPSHOT.jar:0.12.4-dev-df300e3b]

        at jdk.internal.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor31.invoke(Unknown Source) ~[?:?]
        at jdk.internal.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43) ~[?:?]
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:567) ~[?:?]
        at tech.pegasys.teku.events.DirectEventDeliverer.executeMethod(DirectEventDeliverer.java:74) ~[teku-events-0.12.4-SNAPSHOT.jar:0.12.4-dev-df300e3b]
        at tech.pegasys.teku.events.DirectEventDeliverer.deliverToWithResponse(DirectEventDeliverer.java:67) ~[teku-events-0.12.4-SNAPSHOT.jar:0.12.4-dev-df300e3b]
        at tech.pegasys.teku.events.AsyncEventDeliverer.lambda$deliverToWithResponse$1(AsyncEventDeliverer.java:75) ~[teku-events-0.12.4-SNAPSHOT.jar:0.12.4-dev-df300e3b]
        at tech.pegasys.teku.events.AsyncEventDeliverer$QueueReader.deliverNextEvent(AsyncEventDeliverer.java:117) ~[teku-events-0.12.4-SNAPSHOT.jar:0.12.4-dev-df300e3b]
        at tech.pegasys.teku.events.AsyncEventDeliverer$QueueReader.run(AsyncEventDeliverer.java:109) ~[teku-events-0.12.4-SNAPSHOT.jar:0.12.4-dev-df300e3b]
        ... 3 more
08:45:39.349 WARN  - Failed to import block from peer (err: INTERNAL_ERROR) SignedBeaconBlock{message=BeaconBlock{root=0x9054b9a5ee54075f3b1251f2892b4df7034612be384c0dfc245e6ac93c98b613, slot=39425, proposer_index=>
08:45:44.400 INFO  - Sync Event  *** Current slot: 77928, Head slot: 39423, Connected peers: 79
08:45:47.597 ERROR - Internal error while importing block: BeaconBlock{root=0x9054b9a5ee54075f3b1251f2892b4df7034612be384c0dfc245e6ac93c98b613, slot=39425, proposer_index=18074, parent_root=0xb351150d7786a65fe38c9c>
java.util.concurrent.CompletionException: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: State must belong to the given block
```

Version: teku/v0.12.4-dev-df300e3b/linux-x86_64/-privatebuild-openjdk64bitservervm-java-13
A restart with a fresh set of peers looks to have got me past this.
I have experienced this as well! And similarly, restarting with fresh peers fixed it.
